#  Financial Strength Ratings 

Insurer financial strength ratings represent the opinions of rating agencies regarding the ability of an insurance company to pay obligations under insurance policies and contracts in accordance with their terms, and are not evaluations directed toward the protection of investors in Brighthouse Financial, Inc.‚Äôs securities. Insurer financial strength ratings are not statements of fact nor are they recommendations to purchase, hold or sell any security, contract or policy. Each rating should be evaluated independently of any other rating. For more information about a particular rating, please visit the website of the relevant rating agency.

Ratings are current; ratings last required update on April 9, 2021.

A.M. Best| Fitch| Moody's| Standard & Poor's  
---|---|---|---  
Company| Ratings| Outlook| Ratings| Outlook| Ratings| Outlook| Ratings| Outlook  
Brighthouse Life Insurance Company| A| Stable| A| Negative| A3| Stable| A+| Stable  
New England Life Insurance Company| A| Stable| A| Negative| A3| Stable| A+| Stable  
Brighthouse Life Insurance Company of NY| A| Stable| Unrated| Unrated| Unrated| Unrated| A+| Stable  
  
A.M. Best Company assigns ratings from A++ to S based on a company's financial strength and ability to meet obligations to contract holders. A (Excellent) is the 3rd highest of 16 ratings.<http://www.ambest.com>

Fitch assigns ratings from AAA to C based on a company's financial strength. A (Strong) is the 6th highest of 19 ratings.<http://fitchratings.com>

Moody's Investor Service (Moody's) assigns ratings from Aaa to C based on a company‚Äôs financial security. A3 (upper medium) is the 7th highest of 21 ratings.<http://moodys.com>

Standard & Poor's assigns ratings from AAA to SD or D based on a company's financial security. A+ (Strong) is the 5th highest of 22 ratings.<http://www.standardandpoors.com>

  * ### Strictly Necessary Cookies

  * ### Cookies that Share Personal Information




#### Your Privacy

When you visit our website, we store cookies on your browser to collect information. The information collected might relate to you, your preferences or your device, and is mostly used to make the site work as you expect it to and to provide a more personalized web experience. However, you can choose not to allow certain types of cookies, which may impact your experience of the site and the services we are able to offer. Click on the different category headings to find out more and change our default settings according to your preference. You cannot opt-out of our First Party Strictly Necessary Cookies as they are deployed in order to ensure the proper functioning of our website (such as prompting the cookie banner and remembering your settings, to log into your account, to redirect you when you log out, etc.). For more information about information collected through cookies and similar technologies, you can review our [Online Privacy Statement](https://www.brighthousefinancial.com/privacy-policy/)

#### Strictly Necessary Cookies

Always Active

These cookies are necessary for the website to function properly and cannot be switched off in our systems. They are essential to enabling you to log into your account, prompting the cookie banner, preserving your privacy settings, completing forms and redirecting you when you log out, among other things. You can set your browser to block these cookies, but doing so will mean that some parts of the site will not work. Strictly necessary cookies do not store any personally identifiable information.

  * #### Functional Cookies

Always Active

These cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and personalisation. They may be set by us or by third party providers whose services we have added to our pages. If you do not allow these cookies then some or all of these services may not function properly.




#### Cookies that Share Personal Information

Cookies that Share Personal Information Share my personal information

These cookies collect online personal information that is shared with third parties for analytics and to personalize your experience with targeted ads. Under the California Consumer Privacy Act and its implementing regulations, you have the right to opt out of the sharing of your personal information with third parties. You may indicate that you wish to opt out by using this toggle switch. If you opt out, we will not share your personal information with any third parties and your personal information will not be factored into site analytics or targeted advertising. To opt out of the sharing of your offline personal information, you must complete **_[this form](https://www.brighthousefinancial.com/privacy-policy/ca-consumer-request-form/)_**. For more information about your rights as a California consumer you can review our **_[California Privacy Policy](https://www.brighthousefinancial.com/privacy-policy/ca-privacy-disclosures/)_**. If you have enabled privacy controls on your browser (by using a plugin or through other means), we are required to process this as an opt out request for your online personal information. 

  * #### Targeting Cookies

Switch Label Share my personal information

These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those partners to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant ads on other sites. They do not store personal information as such. Instead, they identify your browser and internet device. If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less targeted advertising.




  * #### Performance Cookies

Switch Label Share my personal information

These cookies allow us to count site visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our site. They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site. All information these cookies collect is aggregated and therefore anonymous. Disallowing these cookies reduces our ability to observe site usage patterns and improve the site based on such patterns.

#  Frequently Asked Questions 

Brighthouse Financial, Inc. (‚ÄúBrighthouse Financial‚Äù) is one of the largest providers of annuities and life insurance in the United States through multiple independent distribution channels and marketing arrangements with a diverse network of distribution partners. Until August 4, 2017, Brighthouse Financial was a wholly-owned subsidiary of MetLife, Inc. Additional details regarding the separation from MetLife, Inc., including the tax treatment of separation can be found in Brighthouse Financial's final [Information Statement](/static-files/921a91a4-9a32-4d01-a812-8466202b1a1e) or on [MetLife‚Äôs Investor Relations website](https://investor.metlife.com/overview/default.aspx). 

[Show all](#)

What is Brighthouse Financial‚Äôs ticker symbol and on what exchange is the common stock traded?
     Brighthouse Financial, Inc. common stock is traded on the Nasdaq Stock Market under the symbol "BHF". In addition, the following Brighthouse Financial securities are also traded on the Nasdaq Stock Market: 

  * Depositary Shares, each representing a 1/1,000th interest in a share of 6.600% Non-Cumulative Preferred Stock, Series A are traded under the symbol ‚ÄúBHFAP‚Äù.
  * Depositary Shares, each representing a 1/1,000th interest in a share of 6.750% Non-Cumulative Preferred Stock, Series B are traded under the symbol ‚ÄúBHFAO‚Äù.
  * Depositary Shares, each representing a 1/1,000th interest in a share of 5.375% Non-Cumulative Preferred Stock, Series C are traded under the symbol ‚ÄúBHFAN‚Äù.
  * Depositary Shares, each representing a 1/1,000th interest in a share of 4.625% Non-Culminative Preferred Stock, Series D are traded under the symbol ‚ÄúBHFAM‚Äù.
  * 6.250% Junior Subordinated Debentures due 2058 are traded under the symbol ‚ÄúBHFAL‚Äù.


Who is Brighthouse Financial‚Äôs stock transfer agent?
    

Computershare Trust Company, N.A. is Brighthouse Financial‚Äôs stock transfer agent and registrar. If you are a registered stockholder, you may request transfer instructions, update your address, or obtain a statement of your current holdings by contacting Computershare at (888) 670-4771 or by logging into your online account at [Computershare Investor Center](https://www.computershare.com/brighthouse).

Stockholders whose shares are held through or managed by a stockbroker, bank or other financial institution, should contact such institutions directly for assistance. 
Does Brighthouse Financial pay dividends?
     We do not currently pay dividends on our common stock. 
When is the Brighthouse Financial, Inc. Annual Meeting of Stockholders?
    

The [2024 Annual Meeting of Stockholders](https://nam12.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Finvestor.brighthousefinancial.com%2Fevents%2Fevent-details%2F2024-annual-meeting-stockholders&data=05%7C02%7Calyssa.leano%40notified.com%7C0a88167feaa0496ae76d08dc872566a6%7Cf6156a017c5b4c82b9ba5750c109536e%7C0%7C0%7C638533841949038249%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=8H%2FAMw2ttckJa1e%2F4mhsXaL2be3swL1Xl4X4tYlQHCQ%3D&reserved=0) was held on Thursday, June 6, 2024 at 8:00 a.m., Eastern Time, solely by means of remote communication (a ‚Äúvirtual meeting‚Äù).

Copies of the Annual Report to Stockholders and Proxy Statement are available [here](https://nam12.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Finvestor.brighthousefinancial.com%2Ffinancial-information%2Fannual-reports&data=05%7C02%7Calyssa.leano%40notified.com%7C0a88167feaa0496ae76d08dc872566a6%7Cf6156a017c5b4c82b9ba5750c109536e%7C0%7C0%7C638533841949050026%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=j1cU8y%2BuxNqNSZa%2B1O1w0iioh8wuOPxPsL5%2B41KAwKQ%3D&reserved=0).

Are the Brighthouse Financial shares I received as a result of the separation from MetLife, Inc. included in my insurance policy?
     No, these shares are not included in your policy. 
Who do I contact if I have questions about my annuity or insurance policy?
     Holders of Brighthouse Financial policies or annuities should call (800) 882-1292 (Monday ‚Äì Friday, 8:30 A.M. ‚Äì 6:30 P.M. ET). 
Who is Brighthouse Financial‚Äôs independent auditor?
     Brighthouse Financial‚Äôs independent auditor is Deloitte & Touche LLP. 
When are your quarterly earnings released?
     Our quarterly earnings schedule is found on the [News & Events/Calendar](https://investor.brighthousefinancial.com/events-and-presentations) section of our [Investor Relations website](http://investor.brighthousefinancial.com/). You may also subscribe to receive Email Alerts[ here](https://investor.brighthousefinancial.com/shareholder-services/email-alerts). 
How may I contact Brighthouse Financial‚Äôs Investor Relations Department?
     Brighthouse Financial, Inc. Investor Relations Department 11225 North Community House Road Charlotte, North Carolina 28277 Telephone: (980) 365-7100 Email: investor.relations@brighthousefinancial.com
